text.p: President Clinton Sunday called New York Yankee manager Joe Torre to congratulate him on the team's World Series victory, White House spokesman Barry Toiv told reporters.
The Yankees defeated the Atlanta Braves, 3-2, Saturday night to win the series, four games to two.
"You guys really showed your stuff," Toiv quoted Clinton as telling Torre. The Yankees won four straight games after the Braves won the first two games of the series.
Toiv said Clinton also asked Torre about the the health of his brother Frank, who had a heart transplant operation Friday.
Clinton made the call from a high school field after a rally marking the start of a three-day re-election campaign swing. Toiv said Clinton also planned to call the Braves.
